lines.text: KGB have better cars, you know.
Ah, but they don't always take you where you want to go, do they?
Promise me I can have your face when the breath has left your body.
The director of that film promised me a pair of new boots if I went to bed with him. Think I should?
Well, the winter's almost over.
Exactly, and me a Siberian, I'm used to the cold.
It is more than possible that KGB killed those three people.
I agree.
Then it is likely they are laying a trap for me.
Why?
Three years ago I tried to arrest Major Pribluda. I proved he was an assassin. You remember those two bodies found by the river.
God, it's cold out here. You want to freeze my blood even more?

I always wanted to meet an American. You are so, so different. Forgive me for staring. Only once before did I ever meet an American, in the flesh, so to speak. A young student, Kirwell I think he was called. James Kirwell.
Oh?
But he was dead.
That doesn't count then, does it?
There's a sliver of food on your upper lip.
I'm just a plodding investigator, no style. Completely out of my depth. Oh, yes. Three bodies, three people, shot down and mutilated in Gorky Park, and me, I have food on my lip.
Not even caviar at that. I somehow feel that the executioner, whoever he may be, would have preferred somebody, a more nimble opponent.
You know what a born-again Christian is, Renko?
No.
Born-again Christians. They don't smoke, they don't swear, they don't fuck, all they do is talk about Jesus, try to walk on the goddamn water. That was Jimmy, God love him.
I'm trying to save a life.
Whose?
Mine! I'm on a case that reeks of KGB involvement.
Too many people in our society disappear without trace.
Oh. Why is that?
They fall into a chasm.
What sort of chasm?
The one between what is said and what is done.

[Renko is talking very loudly, and Andreev's lab technicians are listening]
You may not be long for this world, my fine imprudent fellow.

[after reconstructing the face of the dead woman from Gorky Park]
Goodbye, pretty lady.

[Renko and his friend Anton are drinking brandy when Anton's wife, Natasha, brings them vodka]
Wouldn't you two rather drink good Soviet vodka?
No, Natasha, wicked French wine will do.

[Levin has just sawed off the heads of two of the Gorky Park corpses for reconstruction]
Do you want the third one?
We have no idea what the big man looked like. Besides, how many do you think I can carry?
Just so long as you know what to say if they stop you in the street.

[Pribluda suddenly arrives on the scene of the Gorky Park killings]
Greetings, Comrades! I bring you hot water bottles!

[Renko and Pasha are discussing likely KGB involvement in the Gorky Park murders]
Is it that shit-head Pribluda?
That's like asking if the girl is a virgin when you see her in bed with a man on top of her.
What man?
[Renko gives him a "you're missing the point" look]
Oh.

[to the bartender]
A Stinger, please.
[walks away]
Stinger.
That's a whore's drink.
I am a whore.
Girls like screwing foreigners, don't they? It's almost as good as travel.
Well, are you going to arrest me for losing my skates?

shows it to a frightened Irina]
Here is Valerya.
KGB decides what interests KGB.

[Applying grub worms]
The way to do this is to imagine they are your loved one, these little creatures. Oh yes, we need them... and don't the ones you love, eat up your flesh?

[conducting an autopsy]
I'm used to dealing with the dead. The only emotion I feel about one of these is a faint hope it may be a Party official.
